content:
1) Is there a way for people to "block" other people - not see their comments?

2) On the ACT@UCR Zulip, I'm able to delete my own comments. I don't seem to have that ability here. I'd like it.
re. 1), you can't block or mute people (https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/168)
for 2), it should work the same as before.

Disappointingly, https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/8040 is still in progress. This platform looks like it uses the Slack API or something similar to it, and they take the stance that blocking is bad business practice. I imagine Zulip inherited this.

for 2), it should work the same as before

But it doesn't - not for me. When I click on the little downarrow that shows up next to the data of one of my comments, I get an option to edit but no longer an option to delete. That's the difference between here and the ACT@UCR Zulip.
Anyone know if there's a way to tag topics? I can tag streams using # but not topics.
you can tag topics by prefixing them with the stream name and a >, like #general > Zulip questions
Aha, thanks!
(if you type > while a stream name, it should suggest the topics too)

I have now shared the link that @Jules Hedges originally posted on Twitter with several people, and they keep trying to join, but Zulip is telling them they have to have an invite. Does anyone know if there's a way to fix this? Is it true that people have to be invited and we can't just send them a link?

Oh okay I see what was happening. Because Jules' link was shown to me on Twitter as just a big button, I didn't realize it was specifically an invite link. I thought it was just a link to the Zulip. But now I copied the actual link text and it's working.
Derp.

@Christian Williams, you suggested that a conversation in a topic would better move to another stream (and I agree). What is the lifecycle of topics? Can one "move" entire conversations? Or is there a convention/protocol that someone posts a summary in the destination stream and one abandons the old stream/topic?
Can one delete or archive topics?
you can't move topics between streams yet: so it's probably easiest to start a topic in a new thread with a link to the old one, and link to the new one in the old one too
There's a PR that has been merged that allows you to do this, but I don't think the changes have been implemented in their cloud solution yet. I'd expect this to happen soonish tho
When I open Zulip on my desktop it keeps refreshing all the time. I disabled Referer blocking and enabled JS and custom fonts but the issue persists, did anyone else encounter this?
I’ll try the desktop app instead of the website, if it is libre. Maybe it works.
I personally did not experience this, but I'd suggest to ask this sort of questions directly to Zulip devs on their github page

Does anyone know how to get the Zulip desktop app to connect? Because I made my account through gmail, and I have no issue logging in through my browser (Firefox), but when I try to login through the desktop app, I get this:

"This browser or app may not be secure. Learn more
Try using a different browser. If you’re already using a supported browser, you can refresh your screen and try again to sign in."
I have the same problem, I brought it up in meta at some point, I'm still using it in the browser. (Apparently the desktop client is basically a web browser anyway so it makes little difference)
it's supposed to be fixed in the next version of the desktop app if I remember correctly
Huh, well I guess that's as good as I'll be able to get for now - I'll just have to cut my way through a jungle of tabs to get back here every time haha
#meta > google acct + client = :(
Someone said there that you can log out and use the "forgotten password" feature to get a password - you can then also log in with the password rather than via Google.
Woohoo! I'm in! That method totally works @Thomas Read

Maybe it has already been said... Anyway, I usually use my mac to browse zulip, but sometimes I use my mobile, with the android app. I have seen that on my mobile math formulas are displayed not really well. It is only me? Any fix? Cheers.
Beppe.

Beppe Metere said:

Maybe it has already been said... Anyway, I usually use my mac to browse zulip, but sometimes I use my mobile, with the android app. I have seen that on my mobile math formulas are displayed not really well. It is only me? Any fix? Cheers.
Beppe.

https://github.com/zulip/zulip-mobile/issues/2660
See #general > LaTeX support.
Anyone have any way to change zulip into night mode on windows desktop?
There's an option in the settings, but you can also send a message of /night.
Let me try
wow, this is amazing.

Cyphase said:

There's an option in the settings, but you can also send a message of /night.

Thank you so much
